title: Oura Ring 4 ‚Äî Health Tracking You'll Actually Wear
summary: A titanium ring that tracks sleep, heart rate, temperature, and activity ‚Äî without looking like a gadget.
editorsNote: Reddit's r/ouraring is consistently frustrated by the $6/month subscription being required for any meaningful data beyond basic sleep scores ‚Äî the ring is essentially a $349 data collector that gates insights behind a paywall. content:
How to finally understand why you wake up tired some mornings

You slept 8 hours but feel exhausted. Yesterday you slept 6 hours and felt great. You have no idea why, so you can't replicate the good nights or fix the bad ones. Most people's sleep "strategy" is guessing ‚Äî maybe it was the coffee, maybe it was stress, maybe the room was too warm. Without data, you're flying blind on the single most important health behavior. Smartwatches can track sleep, but wearing a chunky watch to bed is uncomfortable enough that most people stop within a month. Apple Watch users charge overnight, missing sleep data entirely.

The Oura Ring 4 is a titanium health tracker shaped like a wedding band that weighs 4-6 grams. You forget you're wearing it, which is exactly why you keep wearing it ‚Äî the compliance rate for ring-based trackers is dramatically higher than wrist-based ones. It measures sleep stages (light, deep, REM), heart rate, heart rate variability (HRV), blood oxygen, skin temperature, and respiratory rate using sensors on the inside of the ring that make direct contact with your finger's arterial blood supply. This positioning gives it clinical-grade accuracy that rivals medical-grade pulse oximeters, not the wrist-based estimates that smartwatches rely on.

The standout features are the morning Readiness Score (a single number from 0-100 that tells you whether to push hard or take it easy, factoring in sleep quality, recovery, recent activity, and resting heart rate trends), the 7+ day battery life (charge once a week for 20 minutes ‚Äî versus daily charging for most smartwatches), and long-term trend analysis that reveals how alcohol, exercise, late meals, caffeine, and stress affect your sleep over weeks and months. The cycle tracking feature uses temperature shifts for period predictions that are accurate within 1-2 days. For users who pair it with the Eight Sleep Pod Cover, the combination of temperature-controlled sleep and detailed sleep data creates a complete sleep optimization system.

The real-world impact is moving from "I think I slept poorly" to "I know my deep sleep dropped 40% because I had wine after 8 PM." That specificity lets you make targeted changes instead of random guesses. Users consistently report that the Readiness Score alone changes their behavior ‚Äî skipping a hard workout on a low-readiness day and pushing harder on high-readiness days prevents overtraining and illness. At $349 plus $6/month, it's not cheap, but compared to the cost of poor sleep (reduced productivity worth $50-100/day for knowledge workers, increased healthcare costs, impaired decision-making), the data to fix your sleep is worth it. The ring form factor means you actually wear it every night, which is the only metric that matters for a health tracker.

‚ö° Set it up in 5 minutes

  1. Order the free sizing kit first ‚Äî wear the sample rings for 24 hours (including overnight) before choosing your size
  2. Once your ring arrives, charge it fully on the included USB-C charger (~60 minutes)
  3. Download the Oura app and create your account
  4. Wear the ring with the sensor bumps on your palm side ‚Äî your index or middle finger works best
  5. Check your first sleep report the next morning and explore the Readiness and Activity tabs
frictionNote: $349 + $6/month subscription required for full insights. Sizing kit recommended (free). No screen means you need your phone for details.
